fail_outcomes.text: You flick your tail politely to the figure. They snarl in response and leap out of the bushes, scowling as they beeline towards you. Once they get close enough for you to see their unsheathed claws, you scramble away from the river and back into the forest. You peek back at them from around a tree, but they stop at the water's edge before slinking away. Lucky you escaped that one!

antag_fail_outcomes.text: You feel a rush of annoyance. Who do they think they are, watching you from the forest like that? You leap into the river and wade across, your ears slanted back as you prowl towards them. Just before you get within range, they leap towards you with otherworldly speed, claws hitting you before you can react. You stumble back, shocked, and find that before you can return the gesture, the mysterious figure already left.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred by a Dark Forest warrior.

antag_success_outcomes.text: You wait until the figure looks away before silently wading into the water and crossing the river. By keeping your belly low to the ground, you're able to creep up behind them. You yowl a battle cry before flinging yourself onto their back and clawing their pelt. They hiss in response and throw you off, glaring at you as they scurry off into the underbrush. That'll teach them to mind their own business!

intro_text: You race through the Dark Forest, leaping over twisted vines and roots as you zip towards the training grounds. You're late for training, and you know that df_m_n won't be happy about it...
decline_text: Breathing heavily, you slow to a stop. You're already late, so what's the point of even going? You're probably just going to get yelled at by df_m_n anyway. Besides, you've wanted to explore this place for a while, and now's the perfect chance!

success_outcomes.text: You have to backtrack a couple times, but you make it there eventually. You casually walk over and join one of the training groups, hoping that no one noticed your absence. When df_m_n finally spots you, {PRONOUN/df_m_n/subject} {VERB/df_m_n/nod/nods} {PRONOUN/df_m_n/poss} head. Phew, {PRONOUN/df_m_n/subject} must not have seen you slink in halfway through the session!

You ignore the brambles that catch at your fur as you push your way into the clearing. Everycat else seems too focused to have noticed you, so you take a moment to rid your pelt of thorns. Once you've finished that, you pad over to the nearest pair of cats sparring and ask for a turn after them.

fail_outcomes.text: Your paws are barely touching the floor as you fly through the forest. You know you can make it on time if you're fast enough. Maybe you're going a little too fast, because a few seconds later your paws catch on a particularly long root and you tumble to the ground. You hiss and recoil as you try to set your paw down, wondering how you'll explain this to r_m when you wake up.

You're going as quickly as you can, but it's no use. You didn't look at where you were running and tumbled down a small slope, landing in a patch of brambles. Thorns clutch you in a vice-like grip as you wriggle to free yourself. By the time you emerge, you're in no mood for training.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred after getting caught in thorns in the Dark Forest.

intro_text: You're training with df_m_n, when you see a StarClan cat, lost. df_m_n growls at the cat, before telling you to go kill them.
decline_text: You refuse, forcing yourself to wake up. df_m_n won't be seeing you for a while.

success_outcomes.text: You make quick work of the StarClan cat, barely trying. As the stars fade from their body, you report back to df_m_n, who smirks proudly.

You use your affinity for StarClan cats to your advantage, thinking one step ahead. df_m_n praises your skill afterwards, stating that {PRONOUN/df_m_n/subject} never thought your gift could be used that way.
You quickly run away, already forming a plan. The StarClan cat catches up to you just for you to jump off of a tree and pounce on them. df_m_n nods proudly.

fail_outcomes.text: The StarClan cat puts up a good fight, but you still succeed. As you watch the stars fade from their body, you tend to your wounds.
Before you can blink, they're pouncing on you, clawing at your face. You decide that you're not ready for this fight, and run off before you get hurt too badly.

You try your best to beat the StarClan cat, but as you're about to get the upper paw, they finish you off. As you succumb to your injuries, you realize you bit off more than you could chew. Your cold body is found covered in wounds the next morning.

history_text.reg_death: m_c died trying to attack a StarClan cat.
history_text.lead_death: failed to win in a battle against a StarClan cat

intro_text: You slink through the shadows, whiskers twitching as you track a particularly interesting scent. df_m_n had claimed that there was no prey in the Dark Forest, but you recognize the smell from your meals in the waking world. Surely it can't hurt to try and find a quick snack?
decline_text: Your mentor wouldn't be happy with you skipping out on training, or wandering the dark forest alone. Deciding it's not worth the risk, you slink back to where your mentor is waiting for you, ghostly claws sunk into the mud.

success_outcomes.text: All you can hear is your heartbeat, beating quickly as you open your mouth, drawing the scent of blood and muck over your jaws. The warm prey-scent is tempting, especially in the midst of all of the unsavory smells, but you're careful to stay hidden as you stalk. Your caution pays off as you reach the end of the trail, stopping just in time to avoid a furious blow from a bloodied spirit. Unsheathing your claws, you leap into battle, waking in your nest with your mentor's pleased growl ringing in your ears.

fail_outcomes.text: Your mouth waters, and you rush after the scent, trying your best to trace it through the thick mud. All too soon, the scent fades, and you're left to slink back to your mentor, empty pawed.

Nose to the ground, you track the scent, barely managing to keep track of it among all of the muck and rot. When you finally find a proper scent trail, you forget all caution, and race forward. But, instead of prey, you run straight into a furious spirit, who manages to land a heavy blow, shocking you right into the waking world.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred looking for prey in the Dark Forest.
history_text.reg_death: m_c died after getting injured looking for prey in the Dark Forest.
history_text.lead_death: lost a life getting injured looking for prey in the Dark Forest.

intro_text: As you walk towards the training fields, a soft sound in the undergrowth catches your attention. It sounds almost like crackling flames, but this is the Dark Forest. Surely there isn't fire here?
decline_text: Fire or not, the mere thought of flames devouring the mud covered landscape is enough to send shivers down your spine. Ignoring the sound, you keep walking, fur spiking with fear.

success_outcomes.text: It makes you nervous, but your mentor would want you to check it out. Making sure to keep a safe distance, you stare down at the flames, watching for a moment to make sure the fire doesn't get any larger, before you walk back to df_m_n, leaving just as a few other Dark Forest cats go to check out the already sputtering flames.

Even though the idea of a fire in a place like the Dark Forest sets you on edge, it's difficult to deny your curiosity. Following the noise, you soon catch sight of the small, flickering flames, somehow burning, even here. You settle nearby, the normal fear a fire would bring receding somewhat. Once the fire dies down, you go to investigate, waking up in your nest, paws covered in still-warm ash.

fail_outcomes.text: Interested, you decide to follow the sound, ears pricked. It's much bigger than you expected, and fear quickly takes hold as you see how quickly it's growing. Turning, you race away, desperately trying to escape the flames. You leap from your nest to the smell of burning fur, wondering how you'll even start to explain this.

history_text.scar: m_c was burned in the Dark Forest.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed by a burn gained in the Dark Forest.
history_text.lead_death: {VERB/m_c/were/was} killed by a burn gained in the Dark Forest.

fail_outcomes.text: All you manage to see of the potential fire is a glimpse of leaping flames, towering against the dull sky, before your courage fails and you turn tail, heart beating so quickly you're worried that it might beat right out of your chest. You certainly aren't looking forward to telling your mentor what happened.

intro_text: The Dark Forest has been... quiet, lately. Usually, you can always make out the glinting eyes of df_m_n peering out at you, wreathed in mud and mist, but tonight, the forest is dark.
decline_text: df_m_n must not be in the mood for training today. Pacing the training grounds, you wait until you eventually wake up.

success_outcomes.text: You've gotten used to most of your mentor's tricks, but this is more unsettling than most. The mist you walk through casts odd shadows, and you wrinkle your nose at the sharp, unpleasant scent. The fur on your spine stiffens with fear, but you push on, eventually making your way through the mist, to where df_m_n has been waiting.

It's difficult to see much of anything in the mist, so you're forced to rely on your ears, swiveling at the slightest sound, everything sounding oddly muted by the strange weather. A couple times, you think you can hear df_m_n, calling into the mist, but it's only when it begins to clear that you finally notice them. They're not too pleased by your struggles, but at least you can start the night's training.

fail_outcomes.text: You plunge deeper into the mist, but you've only gone a few pawsteps when you start coughing, the sharp scent beginning to overwhelm you. Distantly, you can hear df_m_n's calls, but you're suddenly unsteady on your paws. You wake in your nest, still coughing, wondering if the medicine cat will be able to fix whatever the mist's done to you.

history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed after breathing in strange mist in the Dark Forest.
history_text.lead_death: {VERB/m_c/were/was} killed by breathing in strange mist in the Dark Forest.

fail_outcomes.text: You swear you can see shapes in the mist, flinching as you catch a glimpse of one that looks like an enemy spirit, claws raised to attack. Deciding to not take the chance, you turn and run, hackles raised, until you've made it clear of the suffocating mist.

You step into the mist, watching it swirl around you, before noticing the strange, sharp scent. Recoiling, you step back, and retreat to the edges of the mist. You search for df_m_n, but there's little trace of their scent, and you wake in your nest, defeated.

intro_text: You stalk along the edge of a murky river, examining the water closely. One of your Clanmates told you about a rumour that there were fish in the Dark Forest that could eat a cat whole.
decline_text: You cast a doubtful look at the shadowy goop. There's no way anything would be able to live there! You shake your head and bound back into the forest, reminding yourself not to believe everything you hear.

success_outcomes.text: As you inch closer, your paws slip off of the rocks and you tumble towards the spooky river. There's a muffled splash as you hit the water, and you flail frantically to get out. Suddenly, your claws snag onto a large chunk of driftwood on the bank. With sheer grit and determination, you claw your way out of the frigid water and back to the shore. Your fur sticks to your pelt where the water was gripping you, but hey, at least you made it out!

fail_outcomes.text: As you inch closer, your paws slip off of the rocks and you tumble towards the spooky river. You reach out for something to grab onto, but your paws just miss the driftwood on the shore. You give a frustrated hiss as you struggle for the bank. However, the freezing water is soon too much for you to bear, and you sink under.

history_text.scar: m_c fell into a river in the Dark Forest and earned a scar after their frostbite bit too hard.

intro_text: As you venture out into the Dark Forest, you look curiously at a path you've never been down before. You walk towards it before stopping abruptly, wondering whether exploring is worth the risk.
decline_text: You contemplate for a moment more before heading back towards the areas you know. Anything could be lurking under the shadowy trees out there, and it's better to be safe than sorry.

success_outcomes.text: You raise your head fearlessly as you begin to confidently walk down the path. It's unusually cold here compared to the rest of the forest, and the fur along your neck begins to prickle. Before long, you come across a quiet, frosty clearing, which, by the smell of it, no one has been to in a while. You take a moment to admire the few poppies that have sprung up and enjoy the reposeful atmosphere from curled up under tree.

You decide to brave the unknown--after all, what's the worst that can happen? You wander through this new part of the forest, feeling underwhelmed when everything looks similar, before coming to a small field. Here, a surprising number of poppies have sprung up, which is something you've never seen anywhere else in the Dark Forest. Delighted, you grab one, and when you wake up the next morning, it's still tucked behind your ear.

fail_outcomes.text: Your fur prickles as you walk down the path. It's unnaturally cold here, and you're not sure if you like it. After walking a few steps, a cold frost nips at your paws, causing you to stumble back in surprise. You try to move forward again, but the cold bites back harder. It seems not even the forest wants you to go this way.

history_text.scar: m_c received a scar after {PRONOUN/y_c/poss} frostbite took a turn for the worse.

fail_outcomes.text: The magnetic feeling of wanting to explore is too much to overcome, and you set off down the path without a second thought.You're too focused on admiring how the trees in this part of the forest are taller and fail to notice the rapidly plummeting temperatures around you. You surprise yourself a few minutes later when you see a cloud of breath appear as you exhale. Before you can turn back, the cold is too much to bear. Maybe curiosity did kill the cat.

history_text.death: m_c died after {PRONOUN/y_c/subject} froze to death in the Dark Forest.

intro_text: You race through the Dark Forest, bounding with all the speed you can muster. r_c is just a few paw steps ahead of you, having challenged you to a race to the training grounds and taking off before you could answer. You push yourself harder, wanting to beat r_c there.
decline_text: You sigh frustratedly as r_c disappears ahead of you. It seems {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} had too much of a head start, and there's no way you can catch up to {PRONOUN/r_c/object}. You frown and drag your paws as you walk towards the training grounds after {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, not liking the feeling of being defeated... even if the race was unfair.

success_outcomes.text: r_c might be ahead right now, but {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/don't/doesn't} know about the shortcut through a tunnel that you found the other day. You scoff as r_c races past it, laughing to yourself as you dart into the tunnel's dark opening. You quickly make your way to the training grounds, smiling smugly as r_c breathlessly enters the clearing a couple minutes later.

You push forward, dodging spindly trees and hopping murky puddles. By the time you arrive at the training grounds, r_c is still right next to you, and you both collapse to the ground, laughing breathlessly. It's a tie!

fail_outcomes.text: You power ahead, knowing that you can beat r_c if you go just a little faster. After attempting to serve around {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, your paws trip out from under you and you tumble to the floor in a heap of arms and legs. With a frown, you pick yourself up and chase after r_c, but {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} already gone.

intro_text: You pant heavily as you stalk out of the training grounds, declaring that you need to take a break. After padding down a path for a little bit, your whiskers flick in surprise as you see one of your Clanmates up ahead. r_c doesn't seem to see you, and you crouch down low, unsure of how to proceed.
decline_text: You carefully, quietly, slink away from r_c. Everycat has their own reasons for being here, and it's probably better to not pry to closely into anyone else's business.

success_outcomes.text: You approach r_c cautiously, and ask {PRONOUN/r_c/object} what {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} doing here. r_c's eyes widen as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/explain/explains} how {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} thought {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} could use some extra training. You both run through some additional moves, giving each other tips and tricks on how to improve.

When you approach r_c to ask what {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} doing here, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/seem/seems} relieved to come across a familiar face. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/explain/explains} that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/were/was} told the training here was effective, but now that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} here, it's very scary, and {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}'d like to go home. You lead {PRONOUN/r_c/object} to a good napping spot, where {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} can drift off and wake up back in camp.

fail_outcomes.text: As you approach r_c, {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} eyes darken a little. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/hiss/hisses} out that {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} reason for being here is none of your business and you should keep to yourself. As {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/slink/slinks} into the forest, you can't help but wonder what that was all about.

r_c startles as you pad up to {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, the fur along {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} neck and back prickling. Before you can say anything, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/mutter/mutters} something about training before bolting out into the forest. Your head tilts to the side as you watch {PRONOUN/r_c/object} go, wondering why {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/were/was} acting so strangely.

You approach r_c curiously, but before you can say or do anything, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/lunge/lunges} at you, {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} claws catching in your pelt. You jump away from {PRONOUN/r_c/object} and blink in surprise as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/turn/turns} and {VERB/r_c/race/races} into the forest. You're sure {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} wouldn't have done that if {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} knew who you were, meaning the dimly lit forest must've shrouded your identity.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred after one of {PRONOUN/y_c/poss} Clanmates attacked {PRONOUN/m_c/object} in the Dark Forest.

intro_text: Your fur raises uncomfortably as you follow a path towards the training grounds. By now, word of you being shunned probably got out, and you're not sure how everyone will react. Tension builds in your muscles as you approach the clearing.
decline_text: This was a silly idea, and you turn and run back into the forest. Maybe next moon you'll feel a little braver.

success_outcomes.text: There are a few murmurs as you push your way through the underbrush, but they're silenced after df_m_n hisses at everyone to resume training. You pad over to your usual sparring partner and begin a match. After the session is over, df_m_n nods at you, a hint of respect in {PRONOUN/df_m_n/poss} eyes.

You enter the clearing with your head held high, cats watching you as you make your way over to the cat you usually spar with, rdf_c. Curiosity lights their eyes as they ask you all about what happened, and soon you're retelling the story to a small crowd of cats.

fail_outcomes.text: As you walk into the clearing, you try to ignore the murmurs and pointed stares that follow you. However, as you begin to spar with rdf_c, who keeps looking at you nervously, it's soon too much to handle. You mumble a lame excuse about being tired and flee the scene without a glance back.
